stem: A patient with an inferior brachial plexus lesion (C8–T1) shows a 'claw' posture of the hand at rest and wrist extension due to unopposed extensors. Which distribution is most affected?

choices.C: Ulnar nerve (± parts of median) to intrinsic hand
choices.D: Radial nerve to wrist extensors only

rationale_correct: Lower trunk (C8–T1) injury predominantly impacts ulnar distribution and parts of median, producing intrinsic hand weakness and clawing.

rationale_distractors.D: Radial involvement alone does not explain the intrinsic hand deficits/clawing.
rationale_distractors.E: Spinal accessory is cranial nerve XI, not brachial plexus.

evidence.citation: Selski D. Nerve Injuries of the Upper Limb (Slides). 2022.
